alert.note: Alert for Northern Warren; Northern Washington; Southeast Warren (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 30 at 4:36PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A line of showers with gusty winds and brief heavy rainfall will impact portions of southeastern Warren, northeastern Saratoga, Washington and northwestern Bennington Counties through 530 PM EST... At 434 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking showers along a line extending from near Bolton Landing to near Galway. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and brief heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roads. The line of showers will be near... Saratoga Springs and Comstock around 450 PM EST. Granville around 505 PM EST. Greenwich, Poultney Village and Wells around 510 PM EST. Pawlet around 515 PM EST. Cambridge around 520 PM EST. Other locations impacted by these showers include Deans Corners, Grangerville, South Bay Village, Northumberland, Wayville, Truthville, Middle Falls, West Pawlet, Halls Corner and Mannings Cove. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 13S and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern Warren; Northern Washington; Southeast Warren
